name: Bedform diversity
functionStatement: Supports aquatic habitats through streambed material and bedform dynamics. Enhances habitat complexity and streambank stability.
descriptionMarkdown: Presence and clarity of expected bedform sequence (riffle-run-pool or step-pool) indicate organized transport and habitat variety.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Count presence of riffle, run, pool, or step-pool units and note whether sequences are intact.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Flattened or artificially uniform bed.
Criteria: No meaningful bedform sequence.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Mostly homogeneous bed; sequences faint or discontinuous.
Criteria: Minimal expression of expected units.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Some diversity but units less distinct or irregular spacing.
Criteria: Partially uniform bed with intermittent units.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Clear riffle-run-pool or step-pool sequence at expected spacing.
Criteria: Robust bedform variety for stream type.

references: planform metrics (for example sinuosity) as supporting context.
